meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm so excited to dive into this groovy review of Starship Defense. As a seasoned (get it? seasonal?) reviewer, I'll dish out the lowdown on this far-out tower defense game.

First off, let's get one thing straight: I'm not exactly a space expert. In fact, my knowledge of starships is limited to playing Space Invaders in college (RIP, quarters). But hey, that's what makes this review so... stellar! After all, who needs expertise when you have hipness?

Now, let's get serious for a sec. Starship Defense has got some serious game (get it? serious game?). It's like someone took the best bits of tower defense games and combined them with a dash of intergalactic awesomeness. You've got your space-age graphics, your addictive gameplay, and even some clever level design to keep you hooked.

But what really sets Starship Defense apart is its sheer value for money. I mean, come on, you're getting a game that's this good for less than the cost of a decent cup of coffee? That's like getting a free side of space-age fries with your galaxy-saving adventure!

Now, I know some of my fellow critics might be saying, "But what about the graphics?" Well, let me tell you, they're... um, space-themed. Yeah, that's it! And they're perfectly fine for a DSiWare game. I mean, have you seen some of the other stuff out there (cough, cough, VVVVVV)? This is like the Space Invaders of graphics – simple yet effective.

Of course, not everyone will be as stoked about Starship Defense as yours truly. Some folks might say it's a bit too... basic. But hey, that's what makes it so accessible! It's like Q-Games took all the best bits of tower defense and put them in a game that even my grandma could play (don't tell her I said that).

All in all, Starship Defense is a must-play for anyone looking to spice up their day with some out-of-this-world fun. Trust me, you won't be disappointed! And if you are, well... there's always the multiplayer.

That's it for this review – stay groovy, and keep on gaming!
